title.value: Bayesian stroke modeling details sex biases in the white matter substrates of aphasia
title.justification: The value is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Bayesian stroke modeling details sex biases in the white matter substrates of aphasia

extractions.description: This paper explores how ischemic strokes impact men and women differently with regard to language impairments, focusing on the left-dominant language network. Using Bayesian methods, the researchers model the degree of sex divergence in 1401 patients to predict language outcomes approximately 3 months post-stroke. Key findings show sex-specific brain-behavior associations, emphasizing the need for personalized treatment plans for stroke patients.

type.justification: The paper is based on observational data from 1401 stroke patients and employs statistical methods to analyze these data.
type.quote: Our inclusion criteria were met by 1401 patients with ischemic stroke who were recruited as a prospective multi-center cohort from 2007 to 2018 (Table 1 for details).

name.justification: The paper revolves around the use of imaging data to model stroke effects and predict outcomes.
name.quote: We locate lesion-outcome effects in the left-dominant language network that highlight the ventral pathway as a core lesion focus across different tests of language performance.

name.justification: The primary analytical methods used in the study are Bayesian.
name.quote: We provide an honest quantification of (a) the general effects of the derived lesion atoms on cognitive outcome after stroke and (b) the degree of sex divergence in how the lesion atoms achieve the prediction of post-stroke language outcome. All analyses were adjusted for variation that could be explained by age, age2, sex, education in years, pre-morbid cognitive performance, and total lesion volume.

name.justification: The paper specifically investigates language impairments resulting from strokes, focusing on aphasia.
name.quote: Ischemic cerebrovascular events often lead to aphasia. Previous work provided hints that such strokes may affect women and men in distinct ways.

name.justification: This model was employed to quantify degrees of sex differentiation in predicting language outcomes after stroke.
name.quote: Leveraging the Bayesian modeling framework, we provided an honest quantification of (a) the general effects of the derived lesion atoms on cognitive outcome after stroke and (b) the degree of sex divergence in how the lesion atoms achieve the prediction of post-stroke language outcome.

is_contributed.justification: The model constitutes a novel application in the context of this study's specific aim to understand sex-based differences in stroke outcomes.
is_contributed.quote: As a key advantage of this fully probabilistic modeling approach, the inferential capacity can thus be enhanced by accommodating dependencies between parameters at each hierarchical level.

is_executed.justification: The Bayesian model was executed as part of the study to derive its conclusions.
is_executed.quote: Samples from the posterior distribution of the model parameters were drawn by the No U-Turn Sampler (NUTS, ref. 163), a kind of Monte Carlo Markov Chain algorithm (in our setting defaulted to draws = 5000).

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare this model numerically to other models.
is_compared.quote: we could estimate the overlapping and distinct roles of each lesion atom in tracking cognitive facets of language in women and men separately within an integrated modeling solution.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific prior paper for the model.

name.value: Bundang and Hallym Vascular Cognitive Impairment cohorts
name.justification: The data from these cohorts were used to conduct the study.
name.quote: They were retrospectively selected from the Bundang and Hallym Vascular Cognitive Impairment cohorts, which are prospectively recruited cohorts consisting of patients originally admitted to the Seoul National University Bundang Hospital or Hallym University Sacred Heart Hospital in South Korea between 2007 and 2018.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset source is described in the paper, but no specific reference paper is provided.

name.justification: PyMC3 is explicitly mentioned as a tool used for probabilistic programming in the study.
name.quote: Full code is accessible to and open for reuse by the reader here: https://github.com/jkernbach/bayesian_stroke.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference for PyMC3.
